subject: Design
title: The Shift: From Ownership to Access
description: One-minute skill: The Shift: From Ownership to Access.

hook.text: The average car sits parked 96% of the time. The average drill is used 13 minutes in its lifetime. We own too much.

buildup.text: Spotify replaced CD collections. Uber replaced car ownership. Netflix killed video stores.

discovery.text: Zipcar proved one shared car replaces 13 owned ones, cutting emissions and freeing urban space.

twist.text: When companies own products, durability becomes profitable. When consumers own them, disposability sells more.

climax.text: Sustainable design may require redesigning ownership itself â€” from having things to accessing services.

punchline.text: The most sustainable product is the one you share with 50 strangers.

quiz.question: How does product-as-a-service incentivize sustainability?
options: Companies profit from durability when they retain ownership
